basics.name: Hayeon Jeong
basics.label: MS Student
basics.summary: I am an MS student in the Multimedia Computing & Machine Learning (MCML) group at Yonsei University, at MCML, Yonsei University. My research interests include diffusion models, unified multimodal models in computer vision.

publications.name: Dominating vs. Dominated: Generative Collapse in Diffusion Models
publications.summary: Text-to-image diffusion models have drawn significant attention for their ability to generate diverse and high-fidelity images. However, when generating from multi-concept prompts, one concept token often dominates the generation, suppressing the others-a phenomenon we term the Dominant-vs-Dominated (DvD) imbalance. To systematically analyze this imbalance, we introduce DominanceBench and examine its causes from both data and architectural perspectives. Through various experiments, we show that the limited instance diversity in training data exacerbates the inter-concept interference. Analysis of cross-attention dynamics further reveals that dominant tokens rapidly saturate attention, progressively suppressing others across diffusion timesteps. In addition, head ablation studies show that the DvD behavior arises from distributed attention mechanisms across multiple heads. Our findings provide key insights into generative collapse, advancing toward more reliable and controllable text-to-image generation.

publications.name: Infrared Thermal-Guided Adversarial Patch Defense for Robust Visible Person Detectors
publications.summary: We propose a new method for defending against adversarial patches in visible person detectors. Our method uses infrared thermal information to guide the adversarial patch defense. We show that our method is effective in defending against adversarial patches.

projects.name: Phonetic-Aware Encoder Tuning for L2 Korean ASR
projects.summary: Designed and implemented a robust ASR framework to address 'Phonetic Disruption' in non-native (L2) Korean speech. The model enhances the Whisper encoder's acoustic resolution by integrating LoRA adaptation and an auxiliary CTC head for explicit acoustic-phonetic alignment.

honors and awards.title: Best Paper Award - KISA President's Award

volunteer.summary: Contributed to community safety improvements through CCTV installation project with local police station, and participated in youth education volunteer programs.

references.name: Jong-Seok Lee
references.reference: Jong-Seok Lee is a professor of computer science at Yonsei University. He is a co-author of the paper 'Dominating vs. Dominated: Generative Collapse in Diffusion Models'.
